examples: This new ruling affects your business
Don't involve me in your family affairs!
This decision involves many changes

results.definition: require as useful, just, or proper
examples: It takes nerve to do what she did
success usually requires hard work
This job asks a lot of patience and skill
This position demands a lot of personal sacrifice
This dinner calls for a spectacular dessert
This intervention does not postulate a patient's consent
Dinner at Joe's always involves at least six courses

results.definition: occupy or engage the interest of
examples: His story completely involved me during the entire afternoon

results.definition: make complex or intricate or complicated
examples: The situation was rather involved

results.definition: connected by participation or association or use
examples: we accomplished nothing, simply because of the large number of people involved
the problems involved
the involved muscles
I don't want to get involved
everyone involved in the bribery case has been identified

results.definition: entangled or hindered as if e.g. in mire
examples: the difficulties in which the question is involved
brilliant leadership mired in details and confusion

results.definition: highly complex or intricate and occasionally devious
examples: the Byzantine tax structure
Byzantine methods for holding on to his chairmanship
convoluted legal language
convoluted reasoning
the plot was too involved
a knotty problem
got his way by labyrinthine maneuvering
Oh, what a tangled web we weave"- Sir Walter Scott
tortuous legal procedures
tortuous negotiations lasting for months
a castle involved in mist
the difficulties in which the question is involved
